sourceMeaningMnemonic: This kanji is the same as the radical it comes from. <radical>Lack</radical> becomes <kanji>Lack</kanji>!
meaningInfo: If you know the radical you know this.
readingMnemonic:
To remember <ja>けつ</ja>, we use the word "ketsup." It's the perfect blend of ketchup and catsup!

You're <kanji>lack</kanji>ing something in your fridge. You look around, trying to find the <reading>ketsu</reading>p (<ja>けつ</ja>) you lack. You can't find it, because you lack it.
readingInfo: Imagine having to use regular, ordinary ketchup, or just old, boring catsup on your burger. Or even worse, an actual tomato. BLEH!
